title: You Deserve Support at the Cellular Level
body: Low energy doesn’t always start in the mind. Sometimes it’s minerals, blood sugar, hydration, or sleep debt. You’re not lazy — your system might be under-resourced.
echo_intro: For the ones trying to think their way through depletion.

title: Your Muscles Remember Too
body: Tight calves. Clenched jaw. Aching shoulders. Sometimes the body holds emotional tension until a nutrient or rest allows it to release. Magnesium isn’t magic — but it’s real.
echo_intro: If your body hurts without a story — try this.

title: Not All Dopamine Is Pleasure
body: Low dopamine doesn’t always feel sad — sometimes it’s just nothing. No pull. No care. No start. Supplements like tyrosine or movement can help, but so can grace.
echo_intro: If it’s hard to care, even about caring — try this.

title: Your Mood Might Be Missing a Molecule
body: You’re not unstable — you might be unsupported. Zinc, B6, omega-3s — sometimes what feels like chaos is a lack of fuel. You can still be emotionally deep *and* need cofactors.
echo_intro: For the one who’s tired of being called dramatic.

title: Not All Tired Is Sleepy
body: Your fatigue might be blood sugar. Circadian misalignment. Inflammation. Your tiredness isn’t weakness — it’s a request. Your system is asking for rhythm, not perfection.
echo_intro: Try this when you’re dragging without reason.

title: Your Mood Might Be a Glucose Dip
body: Crashes in blood sugar can mimic anxiety. Or sadness. Or rage. You’re not ‘just emotional’ — your system might be starving for fuel. Steady carbs, protein, breath. Start there.
echo_intro: Try this if your moods crash before meals.

title: More Coffee Isn’t the Cure
body: If you’re on your third cup and still can’t feel awake, it’s not about energy — it’s about dysregulation. You don’t need more fire. You need rest and minerals.
echo_intro: For the one who’s caffeinated but still foggy.

title: Let Nighttime Mean Something
body: A warm drink. A dark room. One sentence repeated gently: “The day is done.” These aren’t routines — they’re rhythm setters. Your nervous system can learn safety through repetition.
echo_intro: Try this if sleep feels like a shutdown, not an ease-in.

title: You’re Not Broken — You’re Dehydrated
body: Brain fog can be dehydration. So can headaches. So can emotional overreaction. Start with water. Add salt. Return to basic body logic.
echo_intro: This one’s for the forgotten bottle on your desk.

title: Low Iron Can Look Like Depression
body: When motivation disappears, check your chemistry. Low iron. Low B12. Low D. These aren’t character flaws — they’re fixable signals. You’re not failing. You might just be empty.
echo_intro: For the one who feels slow and sad for no reason.

title: Some Emotions Need Fat
body: Your brain is fat and water. If your meals lack essential fats, your nervous system can’t buffer emotional waves. You’re not unstable — you might just need oil.
echo_intro: For those whose moods feel sharp or sudden.

title: Every Capsule Is a Promise
body: Even when it doesn’t work right away. Even when you forget. Every capsule, drop, or powder is a small act of self-loyalty. Keep the promise. Rebuild the trust.
echo_intro: This is for the one trying to stay consistent, imperfectly.
